column1: inga is an Elvish word meaning "first"
column2: said to be (or perhaps derive from) an element in "Elfin and especially Lindarin names". The word appears without any specific designated language.

column1: Helge Fauskanger has suggested that the word (and its meaning) could be valid Neo-Quenya.Helge Fauskanger
column2: "http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/eng-quen.rtf English-Quenya Wordlist (Quettaparma Quenyanna)" at http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/ Ardalambion (accessed 25 June 2011)

column1: inga is a Quenya word meaning "top"
column2: which was "only applied to shapes pointing upwards" and referred "primarily to position and could be used of tops relatively broad".
